text: I've been taking Lipitor for my high cholesterol for about 3 months now. Started getting terrible muscle pain in my legs and arms. Doctor said it could be a side effect. Had to switch to a different statin.
Voltaren worked great for my arthritis pain but gave me awful stomach problems. Felt nauseous all the time and even had some bleeding. Not worth it.
Started taking metformin for type 2 diabetes. First week was rough - lots of diarrhea and stomach cramps. Doctor said to stick with it and symptoms would improve. They did after about 2 weeks.
This medication is a lifesaver! My migraines are finally under control with Topamax. Only downside is some tingling in my fingers but I can live with that.
DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG. Cipro gave me tendon problems that still haven't gone away after 6 months. I can barely walk. Worst decision of my life.
Been on Lexapro for depression for a year. Works well for my mood but completely killed my libido. Also gained about 15 pounds. Trying to decide if it's worth staying on.
Took ibuprofen for my back pain as needed. No problems at all. Works better than acetaminophen for me.
My doctor put me on lisinopril for high blood pressure. Developed this horrible dry cough that wouldn't go away. Switched to losartan and the cough stopped within a week.
Allergic reaction to amoxicillin - broke out in hives all over my body within an hour of taking it. Had to go to the ER. Now I'm flagged as penicillin allergic.
Taking atorvastatin 20mg for cholesterol management. No side effects noticed so far after 6 months. Bloodwork shows good improvement in my numbers.
